Misconfigurations.Title: Process can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'my-nginx' of Deployment 'my-nginx' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities not dropped
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'my-nginx' of Deployment 'my-nginx' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user
Misconfigurations.Description: 'runAsNonRoot' forces the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'my-nginx' of Deployment 'my-nginx' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ':latest' used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'my-nginx' of Deployment 'my-nginx' should specify an image tag
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'my-nginx' of Deployment 'my-nginx' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low user ID
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the hostâ€™s user table.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low group ID
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the hostâ€™s user table.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default AppArmor profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass AppArmor protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove 'container.apparmor.security.beta.kubernetes.io' annotation or set it to 'runtime/default'.

Misconfigurations.Title: SYS_ADMIN capability added
Misconfigurations.Description: SYS_ADMIN gives the processes running inside the container privileges that are equivalent to root.

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volume mounted with docker.sock
Misconfigurations.Description: Mounting docker.sock from the host can give the container full root access to the host.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host IPC namespace
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s IPC namespace allows container processes to communicate with processes on the host.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the hostâ€™s loopback adapter.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged container
Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default capabilities added
Misconfigurations.Description: Adding NET_RAW or capabilities beyond the default set must be disallowed.

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPath volumes must be forbidden.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host ports
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPorts should be disallowed, or at minimum restricted to a known list.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set spec.containers[*].ports[*].hostPort and spec.initContainers[*].ports[*].hostPort.

Misconfigurations.Title: SELinux custom options set
Misconfigurations.Description: Setting a custom SELinux user or role option should be forbidden.

Misconfigurations.Title: Unsafe sysctl options set
Misconfigurations.Description: Sysctls can disable security mechanisms or affect all containers on a host, and should be disallowed except for an allowed 'safe' subset. A sysctl is considered safe if it is namespaced in the container or the Pod, and it is isolated from other Pods or processes on the same Node.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.securityContext.sysctls' or set to values in an allowed subset, {"kernel.shm_rmid_forced", "net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range", "net.ipv4.ping_group_range", "net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies"}

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default /proc masks set
Misconfigurations.Description: The default /proc masks are set up to reduce attack surface, and should be required.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-ephemeral volume types used
Misconfigurations.Description: In addition to restricting HostPath volumes, usage of non-ephemeral volume types should be limited to those defined through PersistentVolumes.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not Set 'spec.volumes[*]' to any of the disallowed volume types.

Misconfigurations.Title: A root primary or supplementary GID set
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: The RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.

Misconfigurations.Title: Tiller Is Deployed
Misconfigurations.Description: Check if Helm Tiller component is deployed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Migrate to Helm v3 which no longer has Tiller component

Misconfigurations.Title: root user
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: ':latest' tag used
Misconfigurations.Description: When using a 'FROM' statement you should use a specific tag to avoid uncontrolled behavior when the image is updated.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a tag to the image in the 'FROM' statement

Misconfigurations.Title: Port 22 exposed
Misconfigurations.Description: Exposing port 22 might allow users to SSH into the container.

Misconfigurations.Title: ADD instead of COPY
Misconfigurations.Description: You should use COPY instead of ADD unless you want to extract a tar file. Note that an ADD command will extract a tar file, which adds the risk of Zip-based vulnerabilities. Accordingly, it is advised to use a COPY command, which does not extract tar files.

Misconfigurations.Title: COPY '--from' referring to the current image
Misconfigurations.Description: COPY '--from' should not mention the current FROM alias, since it is impossible to copy from itself.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change the '--form' so that it will not refer to itself

Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple ENTRYPOINT instructions listed
Misconfigurations.Description: There can only be one ENTRYPOINT instruction in a Dockerfile. Only the last ENTRYPOINT instruction in the Dockerfile will have an effect.

Misconfigurations.Title: Exposed port out of range
Misconfigurations.Description: UNIX ports outside the range 0-65535 are exposed.

Misconfigurations.Title: WORKDIR path not absolute
Misconfigurations.Description: For clarity and reliability, you should always use absolute paths for your WORKDIR.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use absolute paths for your WORKDIR

Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'sudo'
Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using 'RUN' with 'sudo' commands, as it can lead to unpredictable behavior.

Misconfigurations.Title: COPY with more than two arguments not ending with slash
Misconfigurations.Description: When a COPY command has more than two arguments, the last one should end with a slash.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add slash to last COPY argument

Misconfigurations.Title: Duplicate aliases defined in different FROMs
Misconfigurations.Description: Different FROMs can't have the same alias defined.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change aliases to make them different

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN cd ...' to change directory
Misconfigurations.Description: Use WORKDIR instead of proliferating instructions like 'RUN cd â€¦ && do-something', which are hard to read, troubleshoot, and maintain.

Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'wget' and 'curl'
Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using both 'wget' and 'curl' since these tools have the same effect.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'yum clean all' missing
Misconfigurations.Description: You should use 'yum clean all' after using a 'yum install' command to clean package cached data and reduce image size.

Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple CMD instructions listed
Misconfigurations.Description: There can only be one CMD instruction in a Dockerfile. If you list more than one CMD then only the last CMD will take effect.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Dockefile should only have one CMD instruction. Remove all the other CMD instructions

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN <package-manager> update' instruction alone
Misconfigurations.Description: The instruction 'RUN <package-manager> update' should always be followed by '<package-manager> install' in the same RUN statement.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Combine '<package-manager> update' and '<package-manager> install' instructions to single one

Misconfigurations.Title: 'COPY --from' refers to alias not defined previously
Misconfigurations.Description: COPY commands with the flag '--from' should mention a previously defined FROM alias.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'dnf clean all' missing
Misconfigurations.Description: Cached package data should be cleaned after installation to reduce image size.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'zypper clean' missing
Misconfigurations.Description: The layer and image size should be reduced by deleting unneeded caches after running zypper.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get' missing '-y' to avoid manual input
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get' calls should use the flag '-y' to avoid manual user input.

Misconfigurations.Title: Deprecated MAINTAINER used
Misconfigurations.Description: MAINTAINER has been deprecated since Docker 1.13.0.

Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple HEALTHCHECK defined
Misconfigurations.Description: Providing more than one HEALTHCHECK instruction per stage is confusing and error-prone.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: One HEALTHCHECK instruction must remain in Dockerfile. Remove all other instructions.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get dist-upgrade' used
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get dist-upgrade' upgrades a major version so it doesn't make more sense in Dockerfile.

Misconfigurations.Title: Exposed port out of range
Misconfigurations.Description: UNIX ports outside the range 0-65535 are exposed.

Misconfigurations.Title: WORKDIR path not absolute
Misconfigurations.Description: For clarity and reliability, you should always use absolute paths for your WORKDIR.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use absolute paths for your WORKDIR

Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'sudo'
Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using 'RUN' with 'sudo' commands, as it can lead to unpredictable behavior.

Misconfigurations.Title: COPY with more than two arguments not ending with slash
Misconfigurations.Description: When a COPY command has more than two arguments, the last one should end with a slash.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add slash to last COPY argument

Misconfigurations.Title: Duplicate aliases defined in different FROMs
Misconfigurations.Description: Different FROMs can't have the same alias defined.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change aliases to make them different

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN cd ...' to change directory
Misconfigurations.Description: Use WORKDIR instead of proliferating instructions like 'RUN cd â€¦ && do-something', which are hard to read, troubleshoot, and maintain.

Misconfigurations.Title: RUN using 'wget' and 'curl'
Misconfigurations.Description: Avoid using both 'wget' and 'curl' since these tools have the same effect.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'yum clean all' missing
Misconfigurations.Description: You should use 'yum clean all' after using a 'yum install' command to clean package cached data and reduce image size.

Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple CMD instructions listed
Misconfigurations.Description: There can only be one CMD instruction in a Dockerfile. If you list more than one CMD then only the last CMD will take effect.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Dockefile should only have one CMD instruction. Remove all the other CMD instructions

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN <package-manager> update' instruction alone
Misconfigurations.Description: The instruction 'RUN <package-manager> update' should always be followed by '<package-manager> install' in the same RUN statement.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Combine '<package-manager> update' and '<package-manager> install' instructions to single one

Misconfigurations.Title: 'COPY --from' refers to alias not defined previously
Misconfigurations.Description: COPY commands with the flag '--from' should mention a previously defined FROM alias.

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: PUT calls with public ACLs specified can make objects public
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable blocking any PUT calls with a public ACL specified

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should block public policy
Misconfigurations.Description: Users could put a policy that allows public access
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not block public policies
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Prevent policies that allow public access being PUT

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted S3 bucket.
Misconfigurations.Description: The bucket objects could be read if compromised
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have encryption enabled

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Bucket does not have logging enabled.
Misconfigurations.Description: There is no way to determine the access to this bucket
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have logging enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a logging block to the resource to enable access logging

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description: Deleted or modified data would not be recoverable
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
Misconfigurations.Description: Public buckets can be accessed by anyone
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not restrict public buckets
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 encryption should use Customer Managed Keys
Misconfigurations.Description: Using AWS managed keys does not allow for fine grained control
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not encrypt data with a customer managed key.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption using customer managed keys

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public Acl
Misconfigurations.Description: PUT calls with public ACLs specified can make objects public
Misconfigurations.Message: Resource 'S3Bucket' passed check: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public Acl
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Buckets not publicly accessible through ACL.
Misconfigurations.Description: Public access to the bucket can lead to data leakage
Misconfigurations.Message: Resource 'S3Bucket' passed check: S3 Buckets not publicly accessible through ACL.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Don't use canned ACLs or switch to private acl

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 buckets should each define an aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block
Misconfigurations.Description: Public access policies may be applied to sensitive data buckets
Misconfigurations.Message: Resource 'S3Bucket' passed check: S3 buckets should each define an aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Define a aws_s3_bucket_public_access_block for the given bucket to control public access policies

Misconfigurations.Title: Process can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'hello-kubernetes' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities not dropped
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'hello-kubernetes' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volume mounted with docker.sock
Misconfigurations.Description: Mounting docker.sock from the host can give the container full root access to the host.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user
Misconfigurations.Description: 'runAsNonRoot' forces the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'hello-kubernetes' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'hello-kubernetes' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low user ID
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the hostâ€™s user table.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low group ID
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the hostâ€™s user table.

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPath volumes must be forbidden.

Misconfigurations.Title: Unsafe sysctl options set
Misconfigurations.Description: Sysctls can disable security mechanisms or affect all containers on a host, and should be disallowed except for an allowed 'safe' subset. A sysctl is considered safe if it is namespaced in the container or the Pod, and it is isolated from other Pods or processes on the same Node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Deployment 'hello-kubernetes' should set 'securityContext.sysctl' to the allowed values
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.securityContext.sysctls' or set to values in an allowed subset, {"kernel.shm_rmid_forced", "net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range", "net.ipv4.ping_group_range", "net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies"}

Misconfigurations.Title: Default AppArmor profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass AppArmor protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove 'container.apparmor.security.beta.kubernetes.io' annotation or set it to 'runtime/default'.

Misconfigurations.Title: SYS_ADMIN capability added
Misconfigurations.Description: SYS_ADMIN gives the processes running inside the container privileges that are equivalent to root.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host IPC namespace
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s IPC namespace allows container processes to communicate with processes on the host.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the hostâ€™s loopback adapter.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ':latest' used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged container
Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default capabilities added
Misconfigurations.Description: Adding NET_RAW or capabilities beyond the default set must be disallowed.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host ports
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPorts should be disallowed, or at minimum restricted to a known list.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set spec.containers[*].ports[*].hostPort and spec.initContainers[*].ports[*].hostPort.

Misconfigurations.Title: SELinux custom options set
Misconfigurations.Description: Setting a custom SELinux user or role option should be forbidden.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default /proc masks set
Misconfigurations.Description: The default /proc masks are set up to reduce attack surface, and should be required.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-ephemeral volume types used
Misconfigurations.Description: In addition to restricting HostPath volumes, usage of non-ephemeral volume types should be limited to those defined through PersistentVolumes.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not Set 'spec.volumes[*]' to any of the disallowed volume types.

Misconfigurations.Title: A root primary or supplementary GID set
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: The RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.

Misconfigurations.Title: Tiller Is Deployed
Misconfigurations.Description: Check if Helm Tiller component is deployed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Migrate to Helm v3 which no longer has Tiller component

Misconfigurations.Title: API Gateway domain name uses outdated SSL/TLS protocols.
Misconfigurations.Description: Outdated SSL policies increase exposure to known vulnerabilities
Misconfigurations.Message: Domain name is configured with an outdated TLS policy.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use the most modern TLS/SSL policies available

Misconfigurations.Title: API Gateway domain name uses outdated SSL/TLS protocols.
Misconfigurations.Description: Outdated SSL policies increase exposure to known vulnerabilities
Misconfigurations.Message: Domain name is configured with an outdated TLS policy.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use the most modern TLS/SSL policies available

Misconfigurations.Description: Outdated SSL policies increase exposure to known vulnerabilities
Misconfigurations.Message: Domain name is configured with an outdated TLS policy.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use the most modern TLS/SSL policies available

Misconfigurations.Title: Use of plain HTTP.
Misconfigurations.Description: Your traffic is not protected
Misconfigurations.Message: Listener for application load balancer does not use HTTPS.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Switch to HTTPS to benefit from TLS security features

Misconfigurations.Title: AWS Classic resource usage.
Misconfigurations.Description: Classic resources are running in a shared environment with other customers
Misconfigurations.Message: Classic resources should not be used.

Misconfigurations.Title: An ingress security group rule allows traffic from /0.
Misconfigurations.Description: Your port exposed to the internet
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule allows ingress from public internet.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive cidr range

Misconfigurations.Description: Descriptions provide context for the firewall rule reasons
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group rule does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups rules

Misconfigurations.Title: Enable disk encryption on managed disk
Misconfigurations.Description: Data could be read if compromised

Misconfigurations.Title: API Gateway domain name uses outdated SSL/TLS protocols.
Misconfigurations.Description: Outdated SSL policies increase exposure to known vulnerabilities
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use the most modern TLS/SSL policies available

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a more recent TLS/SSL policy for the load balancer

Misconfigurations.Title: Multiple HEALTHCHECK defined
Misconfigurations.Description: Providing more than one HEALTHCHECK instruction per stage is confusing and error-prone.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: One HEALTHCHECK instruction must remain in Dockerfile. Remove all other instructions.

Misconfigurations.Title: 'apt-get dist-upgrade' used
Misconfigurations.Description: 'apt-get dist-upgrade' upgrades a major version so it doesn't make more sense in Dockerfile.

Misconfigurations.Title: Process can elevate its own privileges
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'test-deny' should set 'securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation' to false

Misconfigurations.Title: Default capabilities not dropped
Misconfigurations.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'test-deny' should add 'ALL' to 'securityContext.capabilities.drop'

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volume mounted with docker.sock
Misconfigurations.Description: Mounting docker.sock from the host can give the container full root access to the host.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user
Misconfigurations.Description: 'runAsNonRoot' forces the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'test-deny' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'hello-kubernetes' of Deployment 'test-deny' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low user ID
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the hostâ€™s user table.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with low group ID
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the hostâ€™s user table.

Misconfigurations.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPath volumes must be forbidden.

Misconfigurations.Title: Unsafe sysctl options set
Misconfigurations.Description: Sysctls can disable security mechanisms or affect all containers on a host, and should be disallowed except for an allowed 'safe' subset. A sysctl is considered safe if it is namespaced in the container or the Pod, and it is isolated from other Pods or processes on the same Node.
Misconfigurations.Message: Deployment 'test-deny' should set 'securityContext.sysctl' to the allowed values
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set 'spec.securityContext.sysctls' or set to values in an allowed subset, {"kernel.shm_rmid_forced", "net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range", "net.ipv4.ping_group_range", "net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies"}

Misconfigurations.Title: Default AppArmor profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass AppArmor protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove 'container.apparmor.security.beta.kubernetes.io' annotation or set it to 'runtime/default'.

Misconfigurations.Title: SYS_ADMIN capability added
Misconfigurations.Description: SYS_ADMIN gives the processes running inside the container privileges that are equivalent to root.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host IPC namespace
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s IPC namespace allows container processes to communicate with processes on the host.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host network
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the hostâ€™s loopback adapter.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host PID
Misconfigurations.Description: Sharing the hostâ€™s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.

Misconfigurations.Title: Image tag ':latest' used
Misconfigurations.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use a specific container image tag that is not 'latest'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Privileged container
Misconfigurations.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default capabilities added
Misconfigurations.Description: Adding NET_RAW or capabilities beyond the default set must be disallowed.

Misconfigurations.Title: Access to host ports
Misconfigurations.Description: HostPorts should be disallowed, or at minimum restricted to a known list.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not set spec.containers[*].ports[*].hostPort and spec.initContainers[*].ports[*].hostPort.

Misconfigurations.Title: SELinux custom options set
Misconfigurations.Description: Setting a custom SELinux user or role option should be forbidden.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-default /proc masks set
Misconfigurations.Description: The default /proc masks are set up to reduce attack surface, and should be required.

Misconfigurations.Title: Non-ephemeral volume types used
Misconfigurations.Description: In addition to restricting HostPath volumes, usage of non-ephemeral volume types should be limited to those defined through PersistentVolumes.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Do not Set 'spec.volumes[*]' to any of the disallowed volume types.

Misconfigurations.Title: A root primary or supplementary GID set
Misconfigurations.Description: Containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: The RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.

Misconfigurations.Title: Tiller Is Deployed
Misconfigurations.Description: Check if Helm Tiller component is deployed.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Migrate to Helm v3 which no longer has Tiller component
